title: The Fool
poem:
Mint, the herb of clarity and health, 
Refreshing leaves, potent wealth, 
Protects travelers on their way, 
Bringing abundance day by day.

title: The Magician
poem:
Oregano, herb of ancient lore,
 A potent charm, for protection and more,
 With fragrant leaves and a mystical air,
 A magical herb, for luck and flair.

title: The High Priestess
poem:
Roses, flowers of self-care and love,
 A magical gift, from the heavens above,
 With sweet-scented petals and a gentle caress,
 A beautiful bloom, to soothe and bless.

title: The Empress
poem:
Rue, herb of magic and repel,
 A shield against harm, a safeguard so well,
 With feathery leaves and yellow flowers,
 A protective herb, for mystical powers.

title: The Emperor
poem:
Cilantro, herb of love and healing, 
A potent leaf, to soothe any feeling, 
With fresh green leaves and a magic charm, 
To keep you safe and free from harm.

title: The Hierophant
poem:
Sage, herb of wise insight,
 A sacred plant, to bring clarity to sight,
 With aromatic leaves and a purifying power,
 A magical herb, for a mystical shower.

title: The Lovers
poem:
Catnip, herb of feline and playful sway,
 A charming delight, to brighten up the day,
 With green leaves and purple flowers,
 A friendship herb, for joyous powers.

title: The Chariot
poem:
Cinnamon, a sweet and warming delight, 
A magical bark, to conjure up insight, 
With fragrant aroma and a potent spell, 
A mystical spice, to weave stories to tell.

title: Strength
poem:
Thyme, the herb of courage and might, 
Sprigs of joy, fragrant and bright, 
Healing wounds and easing pain, 
Psychic powers, clarity to gain.

title: The Hermit
poem:
Rosemary, herb of clarity and light, 
 A purifying charm for day and night,
 With fragrant leaves and blue flowers true,
 A cleansing gift for mind and view.

title: Wheel of Fortune
poem:
Bay Leaf, herb of mystical power,
 A prophetic charm, for fortunes to flower,
 With fragrant leaves and a spellbinding hue,
 A magical herb, for insights anew.

title: Justice
poem:
Nutmeg, the spice of mystic light, 
A fragrance that can set things right, 
A pinch of magic in each dish, 
Brings forth abundance, love, and bliss.

title: The Hanged One
poem:
Yarrow, herb of healing grace, 
A gift from nature to embrace, 
With feathered leaves and flowers bright, 
A soothing balm for mind and sight.

title: Death
poem:
Marigold, flower of the past, 
Ancestors' wisdom it shall cast, 
Psychic visions and protection too, 
Positive energy it imbues.

title: Temperance
poem:
Lavender, herb of magic and allure,
 A calming presence to help us endure,
 With purple blooms and fragrant grace,
 A bewitching herb, for an enchanting space.

title: The Devil
poem:
Nettle, the herb of exorcism and light, 
A guardian against the darkest night, 
Banishing evil with its might, 
A potent magic plant, shining bright.

title: The Tower
poem:
Garlic, bulb of protection and might, 
A mystical root, to keep you upright, 
With pungent scent and a potent charm, 
A magic herb, to shield from harm.

title: The Star
poem:
Aloe Vera, herb of soothing grace,
 A healing balm, for skin to embrace,
 With succulent leaves and spikes so green,
 A medicinal herb, for a healthy sheen.

title: The Moon
poem:
Mugwort, the herb of magic and dreams, 
A mystical power it truly seems, 
Its fragrant smoke, an enchanting veil, 
Guiding the way through the ethereal trail.

title: The Sun
poem:
Sunflowers, symbols of the sun's bright light, 
A magical charm, to fill your heart with delight, 
With golden petals and a joyful face, 
A magical flower, to bring happiness and grace.

title: Judgement
poem:
Ginger root, a fire within, 
A magic herb, to banish sin, 
With healing powers and spicy taste, 
A mystical plant, with a sacred place.

title: The World
poem:
Basil, herb of protection and power, 
A magical leaf, to banish any hour, 
With fragrant leaves and a potent spell, 
A mystical herb, to protect and repel.
